title.value: An exploratory cross-sectional study of the effects of ongoing relationships with accompanying patients on cancer care experience, self-efficacy, and psychological distress
title.justification: This is the main title of the paper.
title.quote: An exploratory cross-sectional study of the effects of ongoing relationships with accompanying patients on cancer care experience, self-efficacy, and psychological distress

extractions.description: This paper explores the effects of integrating accompanying patients (previous breast cancer patients) into the clinical team to support current breast cancer patients. It evaluates whether one-off vs ongoing encounters with accompanying patients impact the care experience, self-efficacy in coping with cancer, and psychological distress of patients.

type.justification: The study involves collecting and analyzing data from breast cancer patients to understand the impact of ongoing support from accompanying patients.
type.quote: An exploratory cross-sectional study was carried out among patients to compare patients who had one encounter with an AP (G1) with those who had had several encounters (G2).

name.justification: The study focuses on the support system for breast cancer patients within the domain of oncology.
name.quote: This study describes the profiles of the people who received the support and explores whether one-offs vs ongoing encounters with APs influence their experience of care, on self-efficacy in coping with cancer, and on their level of psychological distress.

name.justification: The study specifically addresses the role and impact of accompanying patients on the support system for breast cancer patients.
name.quote: To support cancer patients in coping with physical and psychological distress, Takano et al. [9] developed a self-help workbook... A precision medicine approach is necessary to address quality of life issues and improve decision making and treatment compliance in the journey of survivorship, with the goal of returning to the quality of life before the diagnosis or improving on it.
